title: Knights and Knaves Puzzle
problem: On an island, knights always tell the truth and knaves always lie. You meet two inhabitants, A and B. A says: 'At least one of us is a knave.' What are A and B?
expected_solution: A is a knight, B is a knave
expected_reasoning: Assume A is a knight (tells truth)
If A is a knight, then A's statement 'At least one of us is a knave' must be true
Since A is a knight, for the statement to be true, B must be a knave
Check: A (knight) + B (knave) = at least one knave âœ“
If A is a knave, then A's statement must be false
Statement: 'At least one of us is a knave' would be false
This means both A and B are knights
But A can't be both a knave and a knight - contradiction!
Therefore: A is a knight, B is a knave
